title: Supreme ATC Bot
description: I developed a script that scans the Supreme online store for new items based on specific keywords/images and automatically check out when the item is found. Using a combination of Python Requests, Selenium WebDriver, and PhantomJS, I was able to automate the process to purchase items quicker (~2 seconds to find the item and place the order).

title: MCMXC Clothing
description: As a web developer, I designed and built the website for a local clothing company and integrated it with the online clothing store. I was also responsible for photographing and editing several lines of clothing to be used in the website lookbook and catalog.

title: Yume Koi & Gardens
description: Developed a new eCommerce website using Shopify and Craft CMS to sell koi and koi products with ease of use in mind for the client. Currently working on developing a separate website for "Koi For Sale" using Craft CMS for content management and blogging

title: Sigma Eta Pi
description: Tasked with redesigning and deploying the organizationâ€™s new responsive website, my goal was to optimize user experience and increase traffic with a professional, appealing design for the new website. Furthermore, I created marketing materials such as t-shirts, flyers, and banners using Adobe Photoshop and Illustrator

title: Startup Fair LA
description: I worked with startups and other organizations on campus to put together a startup fair for LA-based startups to connect with UCLA students. I was responsible for the website and promotional material such as flyers, and t-shirts

title: Arkaive
description: I focused on the front-end, bridging the gap between design and engineering to build a responsive, user-friendly dashboard for school administrators and athletic departments. Also, I was responsible for creating mockups of new app features and promotional materials such as decks and flyers
